subject: Re: Speaking invitation - WorkTogether

email:
Dear Chris,

I reached out to you a few months ago to ask if you would be interested in
speaking to WorkTogether about your work at Rosalia. However, it seemed
like it was not a good time as it was quite close to your graduation. I
would like to try again.

In particular, we are looking for speakers to introduce WorkTogether members to
open-source projects in the broad area of Javascript frameworks. We believe
that Rosalia would be a wonderful organization to feature as part of this
project, and we hope a talk would inspire our members to get involved.
Typically, we ask our speakers to give a roughly 45-minute talk via Google
Meet, which is recorded and posted on our YouTube channel, followed by
10-15 minutes of Q&A. All talks are open to the general public, hosted by
WorkTogether, and moderated by me or my co-lead Maria.
subject: Re: Speaking invitation - WorkTogether

email:
Hey, sounds good. It sounds like you're pretty busy at the moment and I

out of this for you.

Not exactly related (except for the "interesting beginning of 2024" part),

email:
Hey Rick,

Wow... tense week, huh? We're feeling it all the way from Bridgetown. Everyone
forgot about the heat already.

But how exciting about your trip to the Maldives! I'm sure you and Katie (I
presume?) are very ready for a break. I'm glad you are both getting out of
the house, though. Being constantly home is kind of the worst after a few
weeks. Now that we're also home, I've started dressing up - like
seriously dressing up - just to go out for bread, because there's literally
nothing else. I did make friends at a nice new quiche shop a few blocks
away, though, so now I have that to look forward to. And I really can't
complain.

So, yeah, I guess, much as I miss all of you (so much, actually), I am glad
we're living here. As you say, Cassie has a great environment. She is still
in daycare, and it seems quite safe. She mostly speaks Portuguese, which is
fairly adorable; it's also necessary for when she starts school, so I'm
glad she's picking it up. She does understand English and Croatian very
well, so we'll see if she starts speaking them more as she's older. Anyway
they'll always be there for her.

Hugs,

Polish later, I'll be very happy, but we didn't think it would be very

daughter gets home from daycare. However, if it's possible to do a bit

Hey Rick,

It's great to hear from you, and I hope you and Katie are doing well! We're
much the same as ever; Portuguese is... slow. Cassie's probably best at it by
now.

Well, I'll definitely also be at the wedding (not sure yet about Gael and
Cassie), but of course we'd absolutely love to host you and Katie for a few
days in Bridgetown; anytime in early August should be fine with us. August is
probably the least busy month here, which means that about 1/4 of
restaurants will be closed, but also that it'll be very easy to get around
and see things. I am honestly not sure what you'd do for two weeks in
Iceland.

Anyway, please let me know once you're more sure what your plans are, and
I'm so excited to see you!
